trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationCredentials> uses the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUserCollection> to programmatically access and modify the `users` element of the `credentials` section in the `forms` section of the `authorization` configuration section.

This type is part of a group that includes the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationConfiguration>, the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationCredentials>, and the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser> types.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUserCollection"></xref> class.
Adds a <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object to the collection.
The collection must not contain a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser> object with the same name.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object to add to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object already exists in the collection, or the collection is read-only.
Gets all the collection's keys.
You can use this method to access the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser> objects contained in the collection.
The `string` array containing the collection keys.
Removes all <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> objects from the collection.
This method inserts a `clear` directive into the appropriate section of the configuration file to clear all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file.
All elements defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file are removed.
The collection is read-only.
Gets the type of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUserCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollectionType"></xref> of this collection.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> collection element with the specified name.
The user's name.
A <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object that contains the user name and password.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> collection element at the specified index.
The collection user's index.
A <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> that contains the user name and password.
Gets the key at the specified <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUserCollection"></xref> collection index.
The index in the collection.
The key at the specified index of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUserCollection"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> at the specified index.
The collection user's index.
A <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> that contains the user name and password.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> with the specified name.
The user's name.
A <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object that contains the user name and password.
Removes a <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object from the collection.
This method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file.
If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file.
The object to remove must exist in the collection.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object to remove from the collection.

There is no <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object with the specified key in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.
Removes a <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object at the specified index from the collection.
This method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file.
If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file.
The object to remove must exist in the collection.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object to remove from the collection.

There is no <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object at the specified index in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read only.
Modifies the specified <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUser"></xref> object contained in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUserCollection"></xref> object that must be changed.
